content:
I've just opened a ticker requesting a new filter operator for getting all ancestors (the dual of is-a)
http://gforge.hl7.org/gf/project/fhir/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=10179
Agree with the need for that new filter operation but would prefer it to be called ancestorsOf rather than generalises and might even suggest changing is-a to descendantsOf.
in what code system does descendentsOf != is-a?

Mine is more of a layman's perspective but, to me, is-a doesn't necessarily suggest that I'm going to get all descendants - and I prefer the names used in SNOMED CT expression constraints...but happy to cede to the professional terminologists with a far broader knowledge of Code Systems.
@Peter Jordan descendantsOf doesn't imply subsumption, only general hierarchy. Is-a is a stronger relationship
